TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SeekStoryboard extends System.Windows.Media.Animation.ControllableStoryboardAction
Public NotInheritable Class SeekStoryboard Inherits ControllableStoryboardAction

Docs.summary: A trigger action that provides functionality for seeking (skipping) to a specified time within the active period of a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.SeekStoryboard> action with an <xref:System.Windows.EventTrigger> or a <xref:System.Windows.Trigger> to seek a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard>.
Note that seek operations do not take the storyboard's <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.SpeedRatio%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ParallelTimeline.SlipBehavior%2A> settings into account: the storyboard is treated as though it had a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.SpeedRatio%2A> of 1 and no <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ParallelTimeline.SlipBehavior%2A>.
Seeking a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard> triggers its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.CurrentGlobalSpeedInvalidated> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.CurrentStateInvalidated> events.
## Pause, Resume, Stop, or Otherwise Control a Storyboard Interactively To be able to pause, resume, or otherwise control a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Storyboard%2A> interactively, set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Name%2A> property of its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard> and use a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ControllableStoryboardAction> object (such as <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.PauseStoryboard>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ResumeStoryboard>, or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.StopStoryboard>) to control it by referencing its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Name%2A>. If the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Name%2A> of <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard> is unspecified, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Storyboard%2A> cannot be interactively controlled after it is begun. See [How to: Use Event Triggers to Control a Storyboard After It Starts](~/docs/framework/wpf/graphics-multimedia/how-to-use-event-triggers-to-control-a-storyboard-after-it-starts.md) for more information.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the amount by which the storyboard should move forward or backward from the seek origin . .
Docs.value: A positive or negative value that specifies the amount by which the storyboard should move forward or backward from the seek origin . The default value is 0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Note that seek operations do not take the storyboard's or settings into account: the storyboard is treated as though it had a of 1 and no . ## XAML Attribute Usage \<*object* ="[-][*days*.]*hours*:*minutes*:*seconds*[.*fractionalSeconds*]"/> -or- \<*object* ="[-][*days*.]*hours*:*minutes*"/> -or- \<*object* ="[-]*days*"/> ## XAML Values Items in square brackets (`[` and `]`) are optional. *days* A value greater than or equal to 0 that describes the number of days spanned by this offset. *hours* A value between 0 and 23 that represents the number of hours spanned by this offset. *minutes* A value between 0 and 59 that represents the number of minutes spanned by this offset. *seconds* A value between 0 and 59 that represents the number of seconds spanned by this offset. *fractionalSeconds* A value consisting of 1 to 7 digits that represents fractional seconds. For the complete syntax, see the Remarks section of the page.
